intro: Omphacomeria acerba var. psilotoides, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a rare and primitive vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, thread-like leaves and a low-growing, creeping habit. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with a distinct stem and whorled arrangement of leaves, typical of the clubmosses. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
